H0.text: Condensation is the process that causes water to move from the ocean to the atmosphere during the formation of a hurricane.

H1.text: Evaporation is the process that causes water to move from the ocean to the atmosphere during the formation of a hurricane.

H2.text: Precipitation is the process that causes water to move from the ocean to the atmosphere during the formation of a hurricane.

H3.text: Runoff is the process that causes water to move from the ocean to the atmosphere during the formation of a hurricane.

A4.text: The sun (solar energy) drives evaporation of water from oceans, lakes, moisture in the soil, and other sources of water.

A5.text: Evaporation is an essential part of the water cycle.
